answers.answer: at this point you have over a 99.9% chance of staying clear.  congrats to you.
Yay! Here it is, your SVR post!Again, a huge congratulations!!! I hope we will all be able to do this post very soon!Have a great hep c free life and I hope you will get rid of the back problem too.
Great news! Sorry about your back, I have back problems too.

that is so cool congrats to u,at least a bad back wont kill u but i do hope u found some good pain killers,now u r cured u dont hav to worry so much about takin meds that hurt people with liver disease,my ex has like diabetes, skin disorder, a stuffed  knee ,mental illness and hep c and he was a non responder and he said he didnt care if his other probs didnt go as long as he got cured with hep c.so try to think positive about your back just know that u only hav 1 thing in your life that is annoying u but not killing u and most people in the world end up having something go wrong with there body.i have 5 more shots to go out of 24wk cos gen 3a so im so hoping its worked too.

You are considered cured!  I think if you looked at the infection statistics you'd find that the bulk of us are 'older' (I hesitate to define that) and we have a lot of the ordinary things that come with getting 'older', like joint problems, weight problems, etc.  I've got back problems too and isn't it terrific to cross off such a serious illness from the list of things you have to deal with now?
Dr. office said,"You are "officially" considered SVR 'cured' after 2 years of negative viral titers". Is this true?

question: Received 24 week PCR negative. I'm I considered cured now? Still working on back problem. I'm so happy about PCR
title: SVR
